title: data analyst
description:
responsibilities:
lead the business analysis function, contributing to the development of data-driven strategies.
implement and share innovative ideas for data utilization and analysis.
take a proactive approach in identifying opportunities for data-driven improvements.
showcase advanced proficiency in excel or google sheet formulas for detailed business analysis and modeling.
utilize excel for in-depth insights into complex datasets.
develop and implement interactive dashboards for effective data communication.
apply experience and knowledge in analyzing call center, customer services, sales, or telemarketing data.
provide actionable insights to improve performance and efficiency.
implement and maintain data governance practices to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline data processes.
collaborate effectively with teams to understand data needs and requirements.

requirements:
bachelor's degree in data science, data analysis, business analysis statistics, computer science, business administration or a related field (fresh graduates are welcomed).
good proficiency in excel analysis or other data analysis tools.
ability to speak in mandarin is highly preferred to deal with chinese stakeholders.
experience in call center, customer services, sales, or telemarketing analysis is highly preferred.
experience with programming languages and bi tools such as python, r, power bi, tableau is an added advantage.

if you meet the qualifications for this position and are committed to ensuring accurate and compliant financial practices, please submit your resume and cover letter to andrew@wetop.asia
note: only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further evaluation.

title: data analyst
description:
key duties & responsibilities:
communicate with stakeholders and understand the entire data extraction requirement. 
clean input data, then perform bulk data extraction, and check the data integrity, and conduct analysis of the output data in a timely manner.
conduct ad hoc analysis to support other departments i.e. sales, marketing, operations, and request from management.
identify and rectify data integrity issues and liaise with members and respective data sources/owners.
verify and investigate credit rating and score enquiry against the credit information, and provide useful advice to the enquirer for external and internal stakeholders.
work closely with project and software team to improve end-to-end process.
any other task assigned by management
 job requirements:
at least a bachelor's degree in statistics / mathematics / computer science / actuarial studies / economics or equivalent.
fresh graduates are encouraged to apply.
proficient in excel and programming languages like python and sql.
capability to produce detailed and factually accurate and easily comprehensible reports.
knowledge and experience in sql and/or statistic will be an added advantage.
strong organizational skills and ability to work independently to meet deadlines
good communication and interpersonal skills with attention to details and strong work ethic.
*our recruitment team will reach out to shortlisted candidates only.

title: junior / intermediate data analyst
location: kuala lumpur city centre, kuala lumpur
description:
job overview:
we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented junior or intermediate data analyst to join our team in kuala lumpur city centre. this role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals who are passionate about using data to drive insights, build models, and support business decisions. the successful candidate will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop predictive models, and translate complex data into actionable strategies.
key responsibilities:
collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources.
perform data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and key insights to support business objectives.
build and evaluate predictive models using machine learning techniques for forecasting and classification tasks.
collaborate with business teams to define analytics needs and deliver data-driven solutions.
performance monitoring and debugging of deployed models.
document analytical processes, model assumptions, and data handling workflows.
contribute to the development of data models to support business strategy.
stay up-to-date with the best practices in analytics, statistical modeling, and data science.
requirements:
bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field.
solid understanding of data analysis, statistics, and predictive modeling techniques.
solid understanding of programming fundamentals, with proficiency in languages such as python or matlab will be a plus.
exposure to machine learning methods such as linear/logistic regression, decision trees, clustering, and time series forecasting.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a creative approach to tackling technical challenges.
proficiency in using data manipulation and plotting libraries (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn).
experience with version control (e.g., git) and basic cloud computing (e.g., aws, google cloud) is a plus.
strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex analyses in a clear and concise manner.
ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

title: data analyst (email marketing) – fresh graduates welcome! (rm4,000)
description:
growth valley, founded in 2006 by master louis loh 罗一鸣, is malaysia’s pioneering feng shui company and the first in its field to attain iso9001 international certification. with a global reach, we have empowered over 500,000 students through our professional metaphysics education, earning recognition from the guinness world records.
discover more about growth valley: https://growthvalley.com/en

we’re hiring!!
as a data analyst executive (email marketing), you will play a crucial role in supporting our marketing team by extracting and analyzing data from our email campaigns. you will be responsible for tracking key performance metrics, such as open rates and email forwards, and generating comprehensive reports to help management make informed decisions. this role is ideal for someone who is detail-oriented, enjoys working with data, and is eager to learn about digital marketing. fresh graduates are welcome to apply!

key responsibilities:
extract and analyze performance data from email campaigns.
track and report on essential metrics including open rates, forwards, click-through rates, and subscriber engagement.
prepare clear, accurate, and visually appealing reports for management and stakeholders.
identify trends and provide actionable insights to help improve future campaigns.
collaborate with the marketing team to support data-driven decision making.
ensure data accuracy, integrity, and confidentiality at all times.
assist with ad-hoc analysis and special data projects as required.



requirements:
degree holder in business, marketing, statistics, it, or any related field. fresh graduates are encouraged to apply!
strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
proficient in microsoft excel; experience with data analysis tools is an advantage.
experience with email marketing platforms (especially getresponse) is a plus, but not required—training will be provided.
good communication skills in english; mandarin speaking is an added advantage.
ability to work independently and meet deadlines.

title: data analyst
description:
job overview:
this role requires a dynamic individual who can leverage data visualization, analysis, and trend identification to support business decision-making while also providing strategic insights to drive process improvements and efficiency. the ideal candidate will have expertise in tableau and/or power bi, with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to interpret complex datasets to uncover meaningful patterns that enhance business performance.
key responsibilities:
develop interactive dashboards and data-driven reports using tableau and/or power bi, translating raw data into actionable insights.
conduct in-depth data analysis and trend forecasting to identify opportunities for business improvement.
utilize data visualization techniques to communicate findings in a clear and impactful way.
work closely with stakeholders to understand business objectives and provide data-backed recommendations.
support decision-making, strategy planning, and process optimization using structured data analysis.
implement and manage data warehousing solutions for efficient storage and retrieval.
apply basic coding (python) skills for automation and advanced data manipulation.
ensure data integrity and accuracy, maintaining high standards in reporting and analysis.
qualifications and requirements:
bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., data science, business analytics, computer science, statistics) or a professional certification in data analysis.
strong proficiency in tableau and/or power bi (experience in both is a plus).
expertise in data visualization, trend analysis, and business intelligence.
experience in data warehousing, sql, and structured reporting is highly desirable.
basic programming knowledge in python for automation and analysis.
strong problem-solving abilities with a business-driven approach to analysis.
excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to explain complex data in a clear, business-relevant manner.
preferred qualifications:
knowledge of statistical modeling, predictive analytics, or ai-driven business solutions.
familiarity with process optimization, forecasting, and strategic planning.
experience in business performance metrics and financial analysis

title: data analyst
description:
benefits of this role:
13th months salary (upon company declaration)
project incentive (upon company declaration based on project performance)
transport, meal, birthday allowances (upon confirmation)
sports activities (badminton & basketball), company outing
training and certification sponsored by company (selected employees).
rewards and recognition: long service award / best performer award / role model awards etc
medical insurance (upon confirmation)
optical, dental, body check up claim (upon confirmation)
 job description:
we are seeking a highly motivated and talented data analyst to join our data and analytics team. as a data analyst at snsoft， you will play a critical role in helping us understand player behaviour, optimize game performance, and drive informed decision-making across the organization. if you are passionate about gaming and have a strong analytical mindset, we invite you to apply and be a part of our exciting journey.
 key responsibilities:
data collection and processing: 
collect data from multiple sources, including internal databases, public datasets, apis, and more.
clean and preprocess data for analysis. this includes handling missing values, outliers, and formatting data.
describe a clear requirement for data engineers to build data pipeline
data analysis:
analyze data using statistical methods and models to extract useful information or insights.
conduct descriptive statistical analysis, exploratory data analysis (eda), hypothesis testing, etc.
data visualization: 
use charts, graphs, and dashboards to present data analysis results so that non-technical people can understand the insights behind the data.
create interactive reports and dashboards using tools like tableau, power bi, google data studio, and more.
report preparation and presentation:
write analytical reports and present analytical results to support business decisions.
work with the team and management to interpret the results of data analysis and provide recommendations based on the data.
cross-department collaboration:
work with different departments to understand business needs and customize data analytics projects based on those needs.
support the data needs of marketing, sales, finance and other teams.
data quality assurance: ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data validation processes and quality checks.
 qualifications:
bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., data science, statistics, computer science, or a related discipline). advanced degree preferred.
proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the gaming industry.
proficiency in data analysis tools such as sql, python, or r.
strong data visualization skills using tools like tableau, power bi, or similar.
familiarity with statistical analysis and a/b testing methodologies.
excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
passion for gaming and a deep understanding of gaming mechanics and player behaviour is a plus.

title: data annotator
description:
job description
key responsibilities:
 accurately label and categorize large datasets, including text, audio, images, and video.
review and correct data annotations to ensure quality and consistency.
work closely with the ai and machine learning teams to understand project-specific guidelines.
provide feedback to improve the data annotation process.
meet daily/weekly annotation targets while maintaining high-quality standards.
 requirements:
 strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
basic computer skills and familiarity with online tools.
ability to follow detailed instructions and adapt to changing project needs.
prior experience in data annotation or related fields is a plus but not required.
some english language capabilities an advantage as some tooling may have an english ui. additionally, some training may be only available in english (but may be translated).
text:
data annotator database development & administration (information & communication technology) job description
key responsibilities:
 accurately label and categorize large datasets, including text, audio, images, and video.
review and correct data annotations to ensure quality and consistency.
work closely with the ai and machine learning teams to understand project-specific guidelines.
provide feedback to improve the data annotation process.
meet daily/weekly annotation targets while maintaining high-quality standards.
 requirements:
 strong attention to detail and ability to work independently.
basic computer skills and familiarity with online tools.
ability to follow detailed instructions and adapt to changing project needs.
prior experience in data annotation or related fields is a plus but not required.
some english language capabilities an advantage as some tooling may have an english ui. additionally, some training may be only available in english (but may be translated).

title: data analyst
description:
key responsibilities:
-analyze various company metrics across departments to support strategic decision-making.
-generate regular reports and dashboards with insights and recommendations tailored to each department.
-monitor departmental kpis and identify issues or opportunities for improvement.
-collaborate with departments to understand needs and deliver tailored insights.
-assist in building standardized processes, analytical models, or automated reporting tools to improve efficiency.
requirements:
-bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, business analytics, information systems, or a related field.
-proficient in microsoft excel and at least one data analysis tool (e.g., sql, power bi, tableau, python, or r).
-strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and critical thinking skills.
-ability to communicate findings clearly and work collaboratively across departments.
-experience in data visualization and business reporting is an advantage.

title: junior business analyst
description:
overview
join our diverse, focused team in the growth department, where we research and implement innovative systems to drive business growth. as part of our digital transformation, we have established pipelines to extract, transform, and analyse big data. we are now looking to enhance our modeling and analysis capabilities to drive strategic pricing decisions across departments—from product sourcing to packing and delivery.
 key responsibilities
data sourcing: expand our global database by sourcing data and developing standard operating procedures to digitise it for internal use.
data analysis & reporting: generate detailed reports from sales, review, and invoice data to summarise pricing actions for products, advertisements, and shipping.
business analysis: conduct market reviews, particularly in the automotive sector, to identify opportunities and challenges, transforming findings into actionable insights.
modeling & analysis: prototype and backtest pricing models and analytical tools using python and excel.
collaboration: partner with various departments to understand their needs and design integrated solutions that align with their workflows.
systems development: develop full-stack solutions that support data sourcing and enrichment through statistical, visual, and machine learning techniques.
 qualifications
bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g., finance, mathematics, computer science, physics).
1–2 years of experience with python and excel, including statistical or econometric analysis.
excellent communication skills, with the ability to succinctly summarize insights and propose actionable solutions.
strong organizational skills and the ability to work effectively across diverse functional areas.
 if you are excited to leverage data and technology to drive strategic pricing decisions, we’d love to hear from you!
 benefits 
travel allowance 
health allowance 
food allowance

title: marketing executive - data analyst
description:
job requirements
candidate must possess least diploma or degree in marketing, business, data analytics, economics, or related fields (e.g., ecommerce, fintech, saas)
at least 1–2 years of experience in marketing, crm, or data analytics roles (fresh graduates with strong internship exposure are welcome to apply)
proficient in excel/google sheets; basic knowledge of sql is an advantage
experience using tools like google analytics, power bi, tableau, or crm/email marketing platforms
good understanding of marketing metrics (e.g., cac, ltv, revenue, conversion rate)
strong analytical mindset and interest in customer behavior
able to translate data into simple, practical insights
detail-oriented, proactive, and eager to learn
good communication and teamwork skills
job responsibilities
collect and analyze customer data from various platforms (e.g., app/website, crm, email/sms, loyalty)
segment users based on behavior and engagement to support campaigns
track and analyze campaign performance (retention, churn, roi)
work closely with marketing and ui/ux teams to improve the customer journey
monitor key user metrics like dau/mau, session time, conversion funnels
provide insights to improve targeting, content, and marketing strategies
assist in evaluating loyalty program effectiveness and user satisfaction

title: data understanding specialist - indonesian market
description:
about the role

become a key part of the exciting journey of tiktok pte. ltd. as a data understanding specialist - indonesian market. in this full-time role, you will play a crucial part in driving the success of tiktok's operations in the indonesian market. you will be based in the vibrant city of kuala lumpur, malaysia, allowing you to be at the heart of tiktok's regional presence.
what you'll be doing
develop deep insights and understanding of data related to tiktok's performance in the indonesian market
analyse trends, patterns and user behaviour to uncover opportunities for growth and improvement
collaborate cross-functionally to translate data-driven insights into actionable strategies
support the implementation and monitoring of initiatives aimed at driving engagement and user acquisition
continuously explore new data sources and analytical techniques to enhance the decision-making process
communicate complex data findings to stakeholders in a clear and impactful manner
what we're looking for
strong background in data analysis, with experience in the information & communication technology industry
proficiency in data mining, statistical modelling and presenting insights
excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams
familiarity with the indonesian market and consumer behaviour trends
ability to work independently and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
a passion for harnessing data to drive business impact
what we offer

at tiktok, we believe in creating a supportive and empowering work environment that enables our employees to thrive. we offer competitive salaries, comprehensive health and wellness benefits, and opportunities for professional development and career growth. join us in shaping the future of the digital landscape!
apply now to become a data understanding specialist - indonesian market and be a part of the tiktok success story.

title: drsc t&l: data entry analyst
category: data entry & word processing (administration & office support)
description:
job responsibilities:
provide administrative support relating to internal risk management processes:
receive/ collect data from data requestor, and perform analysis and verification to data requestor.
data entry into multiple systems and tools, including know your client (kyc) system, conflict checks system and risk management system.
keep track and follow up check results.
analyze result, and execute follow up actions prompted by the result.
update data requestor and attend to questions from data requestor.
update systems on the status of requests.
daily and weekly reporting.
documentation of checks and results.
assist in any other ad hoc tasks given.
 job requirements:
minimum diploma in business administration / office management field.
minimum 1 year of working experience in administration or data entry.
working hours are on shift basis.
ability to manage high volume data while maintaining accuracy.
works well under pressure to meet deadlines.
a high level of it user ability, including database entry and use. time will be allowed for adaptation to in-house risk management tools.
has good analytical and problem solving skills.
efficient, effective, have initiative and have a sense of urgency.
ability to work independently with minimal supervision
good communication and interpersonal skills
due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. candidates will only be contacted by authorized deloitte recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.

title: operations analyst
description:
about the role
we're looking for a capable and driven operations analyst to join our growing team. the role blends data reporting, systems monitoring, and cross-functional support - perfect for someone eager to grow into a high-impact operations or business analyst over time.
you'll turn data from our field service management (fsm) system into insights that guide smarter decisions. beyond data, you’ll also play the role of a systems steward - ensuring uptime of digital platforms and internal systems, and coordinating with vendors or it when issues arise.
this role reports to the head of special projects, who will guide you in data accuracy, reporting standards, and operational insight. you’ll also present your dashboards and reports to the ceo office, giving you early exposure to leadership and real impact on strategic decisions.
to be successful in this role, you’ll need to be proactive, curious, and a hands-on problem-solver. you’ll be expected to take ownership of your data and communicate findings clearly across teams.
what you'll do
extract & analyse fsm data to support daily operations and management decisions.
build and maintain reports and dashboards (service performance, travel distance, inventory, esg metrics and reporting).
use sql, excel and other reporting tools to surface trends and summarise findings for multiple teams.
monitor and steward the uptime of digital platforms and internal systems (e.g. fsm, company websites), coordinating with vendors and it support teams when systems go down.
present clean, structured dashboards to the ceo office – focusing on operational kpis, esg-linked metrics, and performance summaries reviewed with your reporting lead.
keep all reporting folders, documentation, and dashboards well-organised and current.
we’re looking for someone who can demonstrate:
1-2 years' experience in operations, business analysis, or data support
proven by: bringing a report or dashboard you built, explain the business problem it solved, and describe any coordination you handled.
strong excel skills (pivot tables, formulas) and basic sql
proven by: walking through an excel model you created. if you've written sql, show or describe a query and its purpose.
a proactive mindset, with a habit of solving problems or improving how things are done.
good communication skills, especially when dealing with vendors, teammates, or other departments.
a strong interest in how data connects to real-world operations and systems.
relevant qualifications
education: diploma/degree in business administration, operations management, information systems, or related field.
technical: excel proficiency and foundational sql knowledge. familiarity with tools like power bi or tableau is a plus.
soft skills: strong analytical thinking, initiative, communication, and a passion for learning.
why join us?
accelerated learning: build confidence through real responsibility, cross-team exposure and stakeholder interaction.
visible impact: your reports won’t sit in a folder – they’ll shape day-to-day decisions across the company.
growth path: 18- to 36-month track to senior operations/data analyst or specialist tracks in systems or bi.
ready to roll up your sleeves and grow with us? apply now and be ready to send us your cv and a brief example of your best report or analysis when we respond to your application.

title: data analyst
description:
purpose
provide analytical modelling and solution to the ipsos research/account team worldwide.
guide, optimize study and questionnaire design for efficient analytics and cost management.
drive the integration of new tools and innovative thinking in analytics to better meet client needs.
the role will require working closely with client service teams across all regions, the team members all are passionate, share a positive attitude, problem solving abilities and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service even during fast-paced shifts.
 environment
embark on an extraordinary career journey at ipsos, where cutting-edge ai work seamlessly intertwines with our day-to-day operations. with a staggering global presence of 16,600 talented minds across 89 countries, we are one of the largest and best-known research companies. join us on a quest for knowledge and innovation, where you'll have the privilege of collaborating with the most naturally curious researchers and making a profound impact on both local and global brands.
as a curious and intuitive individual, an enthusiastic professional fueled by a passion for knowledge creation, ipsos beckons you to immerse yourself fully into finding the optimal solutions for our clients. our environment is a fertile breeding ground for entrepreneurship and forward thinking, attracting like-minded professionals who possess drive, intelligence, and enthusiasm. working at ipsos is dynamic and challenging, never a dull moment!
 outputs/accountability 
communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement
ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution
perform statistical modelling/analysis, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, and finally to prepare core deliverables or report (powerpoint)
ability to work independently, manage and monitor research projects from commissioning to delivery by utilizing well-developed project management skills, knowledge, deep insight and communicate skills.  able to work under pressure and meet aggressive deadlines
demonstrate strong supervisory skills, i.e. project delegation, time management, day-to-day feedback on performance and behavior, conduct performance reviews.
keep abreast of current trends within market research, to develop personal skills / knowledge base and display specialist knowledge of a market and share this with others
keenness to learn and proactive self-development and development of others
assist with recruitment and couching of junior staffs
 competencies 
analytical/critical/forward thinking | problem-solving | decision-making | communication management | project management | client service/focus | achievement oriented | adaptability | collaboration | embracing diversity | nurturing innovation | proactive | multi-tasking |attention to detail | curiosity
 relationships
effective interface with client service and project teams
promote teamwork in the business area, division and across ipsos 
lead by example and behavior (incorporating values) within the business area
direct and manage the project team activities 
behave in a manner that displays professionalism, integrity and corporate citizenship at all times
 development
develop a good breadth of experience of different analysis techniques
confidence and demonstrated capabilities & creativities in applying different tools, techniques and approaches
demonstrate strong capabilities and leadership in one’s project, people and business management
understanding of personal actions on business and client
 background
experience:
at least 1 years of experiences in marketing data analytics/data science or similar fields
understand and use statistical analysis 
solid experience in project management
bonus: experienced in market research  
 skills/knowledge:
statistical analysis and knowledge
data manipulation
analytical tools proficiency (eg. microsoft excel, spss, sas are essential)
programming languages - python or r for data analysis and data visualization
solid communication skills
couching and mentoring skills
bonus: experienced in ai, machine learning and deep learning 
 qualifications:
degree in data science, statistics/mathematics, business analytics, computer science, actuarial science, psychology, social science or related studies

title: data analyst (fresh graduate opportunity/internship placement)
description:
fresh graduate program:
fresh graduate program of huawei malaysia is ongoing. this program offers outstanding local talents fixed-term contracts for an accelerated career, to boost their career while participating in multiple countries' ict development.
 target audience:
fresh graduate who is going to graduate or has graduated in year 2024 and 2025.
undergraduate student who is looking for internship placement in year 2025.
 job descriptions
data analysis: review and analyze telecommunication data from various markets to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.
data mining: extract and analyze large volumes of data to discover patterns and insights.
data modelling: develop statistical models to understand and predict customer behavior or market trends.
data profiling: assess the quality, structure, and integrity of data to ensure it is suitable for analysis or use in business decisions.
reporting: create comprehensive reports and visualizations to communicate data-driven insights to internal stakeholders across different regions.
data management: collect, analyze, and store data in an organized manner for efficient retrieval and compliance with international data regulations.
 requirements
pursuing or completed a bachelor’s degree in computer science / data science / mathematics / statistics or a related field. candidates from other fields may also be considered on a case-by-case basis.
technical skills: proficiency in data analysis and visualization software (python, sql, excel, tableau) and basic knowledge of coding languages, machine learning, and software development.
analytical skills: strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to derive insights from data.
communication skills: excellent written and verbal communication skills. ability to communicate effectively with international teams.
statistical knowledge: understanding of basic statistics and mathematical concepts.
adaptability: able to adapt to challenges and pressure in a fast-paced environment.
 *positions are offered by huawei or huawei's service provider.

title: business intelligence analyst
description:
position overview
we are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented business intelligence analyst to join our team. the ideal candidate should have 1 to 3 years of experience in data modelling, reporting, data visualization, and data analysis. you will work closely with stakeholders across various business functions to ensure that accurate data, reports, and dashboards are made available on a timely basis, allowing business users to make informed decisions.
key responsibilities
develop and maintain reports and dashboards using bi tools such as power bi and sap business objects
extract data from various sources using sql language
automate or optimize current processes to improve efficiency
collaborate with data engineers to build data models and prepare datasets for business users
collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver useful, reliable, and innovative solutions
identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data and present findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
prepare technical documentation for various solutions built
qualifications
bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field
1 to 3 years of experience as a bi analyst or a similar role, preferably in the financial industry
technical skills:
proficient in mysql or ms sql for data extraction and manipulation
strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and etl processes
experienced in microsoft power bi or other dashboarding tools
knowledge of apache airflow and python is a plus.
knowledge of sap business objects is a plus
soft skills:
excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
detail-oriented and self-motivated to acquire new skills and knowledge, and adapt to a fast-paced environment
able to work collaboratively in a team
diversity & inclusion commitment
tune protect is committed to providing equal employment to all individuals regardless of their race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.
we try make sure everyone has a fair chance to work with us, no matter where they’re from or who they are. we believe having different kinds of people on our team makes us better and more creative. our friendly environment is all about treating every person with respect and making sure everyone’s ideas count. we want people from all walks of life to apply and be part of our mission to create a place where everyone is welcome and valued.

title: data analyst (manufacturing)
description:
job purpose
create, develop, and sustain power bi reports and dashboards.
data analyst delivers value by taking data, using it to answer questions and communicate the results to help make business decisions.
build and optimize the systems that allow data scientist and analysts to perform their work. ensures data is properly received, transformed, stored, and made accessible to other users.
managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements
supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
providing technical expertise on data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
working alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs.
qualifications:
bachelor’s degree in data analytic or any related field.
preferably experienced with microsoft technology stacks (power bi, database server, ssis, ssrs), and r/python programming.
data management skill. metadata design.
proficiency in data etl and backend system integration.
strong communications skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
ability to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies and tools.
on-site (monday to friday) 9am- 6pm
assessable by public transport / train station lrt or mrt (ampang part/ persiaran klcc)

title: bi analyst
description:
we are looking for a skilled business intelligence (bi) analyst to join our team. the bi analyst will be responsible for analyzing data to provide actionable insights, support strategic decision-making, and optimize business performance. the candidate will play a key role in delivering data-driven recommendations to enhance customer experience, maximize revenue, and improve operational efficiency.
 responsibilities
analyze large data sets from various sources, including customer behavior, product performance, and financial metrics, to identify trends and opportunities.
develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reporting tools to visualize data and track key performance indicators (kpis).
work closely with stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and product teams, to provide data insights that support strategic business decisions.
monitor and evaluate customer activity, including churn rates, customer segmentation, and lifetime value (ltv) to inform marketing and retention strategies.
identify opportunities for optimization in product offerings, customer acquisition, and retention strategies.
perform ad-hoc analysis to answer business questions, troubleshoot performance issues, and suggest improvements.
collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data collection, storage, and retrieval.
present findings and recommendations to management in clear and concise reports or presentations.
assist in forecasting models, predictive analytics, and other advanced data techniques to enhance decision-making.
 skills
excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets.
strong communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholders.
 requirements
advanced/higher/graduate diploma, bachelor's degree, post graduate diploma, professional degree in data science, business analytics, computer science, or a related field.
minimum of 2 - 4 years of professional experience in bi.
experience with data warehousing and etl processes is a plus.
proven experience as a bi analyst.
proficiency in data visualization tools such as tableau, metabase and power bi.
strong sql skills and experience working with databases to extract and analyze data.
familiarity with statistical tools and methods for data analysis and modeling is a plus.
ability to manage multiple projects and deliver accurate results in a fast-paced environment.
 benefits
5 working days
casual (e.g. t-shirts)
epf & socso
team buildings
plenty of coffee & snacks
annual and medical leave
performance bonus
open, friendly, and positive working environment

title: data analyst
location: kuala lumpur city centre, kuala lumpur
description:
job responsibilities:
1. foster a collaborative and innovative team culture to drive excellence in data analysis.
2. evaluate large data sets with advanced statistical methods (like azure machine learning) to model predictive results.
3. maximise data capabilities by building data lakes and historical analysis and ensuring data integrity and security for analytics, exploration, and characterisation.
4. research and continuous development of algorithms to predict sales and customer behaviours using real time point of sales, crm and erp and other unstructured data sources.
5. develop downstream analytics solutions for operations, finance and marketing through using data visualisation tools such as power bi to assist business in kpi tracking, automate/improve processes.
6. able to extract insights and employ best-in-class data visualisation and analytics practices to enable effective decision making.
7. test the solution with real live data & present the results and provide strategic recommendations to senior management.
8. define and monitor key performance indicators (kpis) for the data team.
9. regularly assess and report on team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.
10. work closely with key stakeholders across all departments to create valuable reports and further drive data driven business decisions.
11. this is a regional role and support for all markets is expected.
job requirements:
1. bachelor’s degree in computer science or engineering or equivalent with minimum 5 years of working experience preferably in the f&b industry.
2. having other related professional certificates in data analytic is an advantage
3. demonstrate proficiency in analysing data, assessing situations, and providing strategic recommendations.
4. knowledge and hands-on experience in python are advantageous, particularly for data manipulation, analysis, and applying machine learning techniques.
5. proficient in using power bi, including development of interactive dashboards and reports.
6. skilled in dax (data analysis expressions) and m query (power query formula language) for building complex calculations and data transformations in power bi.
7. experience with power bi row-level security (rls) to manage data access based on user roles is highly preferable.
8. proven experience in troubleshooting and problem resolution. exhibit expertise in diagnosing and resolving issues promptly.
9. possess strong technical skills in data engineering and analytics, including experience with etl processes, data integration workflows, and data architecture best practices to support scalable analytics solutions.
10. demonstrate strong leadership qualities, including the ability to motivate and lead a team towards success.
11. possessing outstanding communication proficiency in both written and verbal forms, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and understandable manner.
12. previous experience in using business intelligence tools or equivalent.

title: business analyst
description:
job description
a business analyst plays a crucial role in bridging the gap between business needs and technological solutions. this position involves analyzing and understanding the organization's processes, identifying opportunities for improvement, and recommending effective solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity.
 responsibilities:
generate, analyze, and validate comprehensive functional specifications.
facilitate discussions and negotiations to align requirements among various stakeholders.
collaborate with developers in design sessions to define effective solutions based on use cases.
produce system design components such as use cases, business rules, wireframes, and detailed functional documents.
conduct quality assurance checks to ensure deliverables meet established quality standards.
undertake certification assurance and secure approval with emvco.
share essential insights and discoveries with the team.
continuously seek opportunities to enhance monitoring, identify and resolve issues, and deliver greater value.
 job requirements
 requirements:
possesses a degree in it / computer science / business management or an equivalent qualification.
demonstrates a high level of adaptability to excel in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.
exhibits proficient writing skills for procedures and reports, along with effective verbal communication abilities.
demonstrates strong presentation skills.
displays critical thinking capabilities, a sense of responsibility, and a collaborative team-oriented approach.
an advantageous addition would be 1 to 3 years of experience in a business analyst role.
 what we value 
we value growth-minded and collaborative people with high learning agility. every member of soft space is passionate about fintech and ready to give 100% in helping us achieve our mission. 
 working at soft space 
at soft space, we want you to be well and thrive. our generous benefits package includes: 
competitive salary packages 
medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits 
awards 
bonus & increment 
flexible working hours 
regular team bonding and celebration of festival

title: research and data analyst
description:
🔎 about the role
we’re looking for an experienced research & data analyst to join our dynamic team at platform one (malaysia) sdn. bhd. in this full-time role based in petaling jaya, you will be a key contributor to data-driven decision-making, your analysis and insights will support marketing, business strategy, and research initiatives.
📊 what you’ll be doing
collect, clean, and manage large volumes of data from surveys, digital platforms, and client sources.
ensure data integrity through thorough cleaning, validation, and transformation of raw datasets.
develop, optimise, and run spss syntax for dataset generation, cleaning, and validation across multiple research projects.
apply statistical methods, predictive modelling, and segmentation techniques to derive actionable insights.
conduct detailed cross-tabulation analysis of survey and market datasets; summarise insights in client-facing powerpoint reports.
build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools to support internal teams and external clients.
collaborate with cross-functional teams — including insights, product, and client success — to translate business needs into analytical outputs.
manage timelines and deliverables to ensure high-quality insights are produced on schedule.
🎯 what we’re looking for
minimum 2 years of experience in a data analysis or research role, preferably within marketing or communications.
proficient in spss, including syntax scripting and batch processing. familiarity with r or python is a plus.
strong command of microsoft excel and powerpoint for data analysis and presentation creation.
solid foundation in statistical concepts, such as weighting, significance testing, and segmentation.
experience working with complex survey data and cross-tabulation tools (e.g., askia, q, displayr or similar).
high attention to detail and a strong sense of accountability for data quality.
ability to prioritise, work independently, and manage multiple projects under tight deadlines.
a degree in mathematics, statistics, information science, or a related quantitative field.
🎁 what we offer
flexible working arrangements and a people-first company culture.
healthcare benefits.
opportunities for upskilling and professional certification.
a role that allows you to grow into deeper analytical or research specialisation.
🌍 about us

platform one (malaysia) sdn. bhd. is part of a global network of researchers, strategists, and technologists. we deliver insight-led marketing and data solutions that help brands make smarter decisions. we're innovative, curious, and committed to excellence — and we’re growing.
apply now to join our growing team and be a part of our exciting journey!

description:

title: executive/specialist - data analyst
description:
key responsibilities:
·serve as a power bi consultant to support analytics and reporting needs of the authority, offering both strategic consultation and hands-on development expertise.
·possess a minimum of 2 years or 2 years and above of hands-on experience with power bi, including requirement gathering, visual design, report implementation, and application of best practices.
·provide expert guidance on the development, maintenance, and management of advanced reports, dashboards, and business intelligence (bi) solutions using power bi.
·analyze and interpret data to identify trends, patterns, and insights, and offer recommendations to improve decision-making through clear visual storytelling.
·support the entire bi lifecycle, including data analysis, data validation, mapping, design, and implementation of bi solutions.
·collaborate with stakeholders to review, enhance, and modernize existing bi systems, ensuring alignment with business goals.
·conduct unit testing and develop sql/database queries to assess system performance and resolve data-related issues.
·work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate power bi with other systems and data sources for unified reporting.
·provide daily operational support for power bi dashboards and reports, including troubleshooting, maintenance, and user assistance.
requirements for the role:
skills:
·power bi data analyst associate.
·excellent command of spoken & written english and mandarin is added advantage.
·good multitasking ability.
·excellent computer knowledge: ms office including ms outlook and surfing the internet for information/research.
·excellent presentation and communication skills.
·fast typing skills (minimum 35 words per minute).
·good problem-solving skills.
·preferably with contact center background.
experience:
· at least 2 years or above 2 years of related hands-on power bi.
·experience knowing requirement process, visual design & implementation, and best practice.
education
·diploma, degree, or an equivalent professional qualification in any principle.
the package:
·         attractive salary (rm6,250 – rm10,800).
·         mandarin is an added advantage.
·         annual leave 15 days.
·         medical leave 14 days.
·         medical and hospitalization coverage.
·         working location: bangsar south, kuala lumpur.

title: data insights & system solutions specialist
description:
as a business intelligence & systems specialist, you will provide comprehensive technical support for the department’s systems, ensuring smooth operations while analysing data to deliver insights that drive informed decision-making. your key responsibilities include maintaining the accuracy and integrity of reports, managing system functionality, and offering training and support on reporting tools.
 roles & responsibilities 
analyse data to identify trends and insights that provide actionable recommendations, helping stakeholders to make informed decisions and improve business outcomes. 
administered the accuracy and consistency of all reports, with a focus on timely delivery.
oversee the registration and reporting of warranties, ensuring all relevant data is captured and maintained accurately for operational efficiency and compliance.
in charge of systems’ user id creation and testing of new features to make sure optimal system functionality. 
provide training and support to users on system functionalities and reporting tools to ensure seamless adoption and effective use.
collaborated closely with business units to understand their reporting needs and deliver customized solutions that align with their objectives.
serve as the primary point of contact for system-related issues, providing timely resolution or escalation when necessary. 
 skills & qualifications
candidate must possess at least advanced/higher/graduate diploma, bachelor's degree, post graduate diploma, professional degree in business studies/ administration/management or equivalent.
at least 2 years of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
good in microsoft excel formulas and strong in analysing numbers and data.
excellent technical problem solving and interpersonal skills. 
demonstrated ability to perform effectively under pressure. 
excellent organizational skill, proven track record of delivering quality results.
1 year renewable contract available

title: data analyst (hybrid working)
description:
company description
about seek
seek operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including jobstreet and jobsdb in asia. seek has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
founded and headquartered in melbourne, australia, seek has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the australian securities exchange.
seek’s presence spans australia, new zealand, hong kong, indonesia, malaysia, the philippines, singapore and thailand. additionally, seek has minority investments in employment marketplaces in china, south korea and bangladesh.
seek develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
in 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, seek was recognised as one of australia’s top ten places to work in technology in the afr boss best places to work awards. seek was also named a 5-star employer of choice by hrd asia in 2024 and won four accolades at talentcorp’s life at work awards 2023 in malaysia.
job description
join seek pass, the trusted digital passport revolutionizing how people manage and share their verified credentials across the job market. we're a fast-growing scale-up within seek, operating across malaysia, australia, and beyond.
what you'll do
be the analytics champion
drive data-driven decision making across our entire product suite
build dashboards and kpi monitoring that guide strategic decisions
partner with engineering, product, and operations to uncover game-changing insights
analyze user behavior, funnel performance, and business metrics that directly impact millions of users
shape product strategy
conduct a/b testing and statistical analysis to optimize user experience
provide analytical support for multiple product squads simultaneously
deliver strategic business analysis that influences our roadmap
help evolve our analytics infrastructure and tooling
qualifications
 what we're looking for
sql expert: advanced skills in managing complex, large-scale datasets
storyteller: ability to find meaning in data and communicate insights clearly
analytics pro: experience with a/b testing, funnel analysis, and statistical significance
tool savvy: familiarity with tableau, databricks, python/r is highly valued
collaborative: strong communication skills across technical and business teams
startup mindset: comfortable with ambiguity and willing to roll up your sleeves
why this role?
work in a cross-functional scale-up environment with 80+ talented people across kl, melbourne, and sydney. you'll have direct impact on a product that's transforming how people showcase their credentials to employers, while being part of seek's larger data science community.
desired values
believed in aiming high to deliver world-class results and yet, not forgetting to care for others
additional information
at seek we offer:
annual performance bonus plan
support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
paid and unpaid leave benefits including personal flexi days  as well as the opportunity to purchase additional leave
at seek, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. we are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
we know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. as such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. if you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
seek kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

title: data product analyst
description:
about the role

join miya global technology' as a data product analyst in our fast-paced kuala lumpur office. as a key member of our information & communication technology team, you will be responsible for translating business requirements into data-driven solutions that drive strategic decision-making for the company.
what you'll be doing
develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive data management system, ensuring the stability and security of company-wide data operations through well-defined processes, policies, and tools.
design data strategies for social platform users and establish a business metric system, leveraging data infrastructure to support product direction and growth strategies.
identify and refine business data analysis scenarios, extract and address analytics needs from stakeholders, and iteratively enhance data platform applications to empower business functions.
drive data-driven initiatives, overseeing company-wide data product development, data governance, and data asset management, with a focus on data security and compliance.
conduct routine data analysis, maintain data reports, and provide insights to address business challenges.
what we're looking for
bachelor’s degree or above in mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
proven experience as a data analyst, business analyst, or in a similar data-driven role
proficient in product prototyping tools, with experience in building data systems or data products, and strong skills in requirement abstraction and product design.
strong data-driven mindset, proficient in sql, with a high sensitivity to data, and familiarity with data analysis and data visualization.
possesses business acumen and a strong understanding of industry trends; goal-oriented, able to work efficiently in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment, with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
highly execution-driven, proactive, capable of independent thinking, summarization, and problem-solving.
proficiency in mandarin is preferred to effectively communicate with mandarin-speaking clients.
about us
miya global technology sdn bhd is a leading technology company specializing in original software development and operations for the internet and mobile internet sectors. with years of technical expertise and r&d experience, we have established a strong presence in voice, video, live streaming, and social networking. our innovative solutions and deep industry knowledge have positioned us at the forefront of the digital entertainment and communication industry.
apply now for this exciting opportunity to become our next data product analyst!

proficient in product prototyping tools, with experience in building data systems or data products, and strong skills in requirement abstraction and product design.
strong data-driven mindset, proficient in sql, with a high sensitivity to data, and familiarity with data analysis and data visualization.

title: data analyst
company: destination resorts and hotels sdn bhd
description:
job overview
the primary responsibility of this role is to implement, monitor, and maintain program initiatives that support the company’s strategic objectives.  the role requires strong data-driven insights to enhance decision-making and deliver high-impact guest experiences and commercial outcomes.
job responsibilities
project oversight & reporting
support multiple project teams by developing data dashboards, tracking kpis, preparing proposals, and ensuring timely, data-backed updates to senior management. monitor budget utilisation and support project tracking mechanisms.
data analysis & insights
develop and implement assessment protocols to evaluate program performance and identify areas for improvement. analyse guest behaviour and footfall patterns to inform strategic decisions and uncover new business opportunities.
product & experience development
translate insights into recommendations for enhancing existing experiences and proposing new products or offerings aligned with visitor trends and destination strategy.
 digital ui/ux optimization
managing the user journey across digital touchpoints, including the mobile app and website.  ensure ongoing improvements in ui/ux based on data insights, user behaviour and stakeholder feedback.
job requirements
educational qualifications
bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, data analytics/science and related field.
professional experience
minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in marketing, market research, content management, events coordination, project management
 proficient in data visualisation tools (e.g., power bi, tableau), google analytics, as well as microsoft excel and powerpoint.
 strong understanding of customer segmentation, digital analytics, and ux principles.
characteristic / behaviour /competencies
excellent communication and presentation skills
attention to detail, passionate, positive attitude, team player
able to work collaboratively across multidisciplinary teams

title: machine learning engineer (ai)
description:
we are looking for a highly skilled and passionate individual to join the position of machine learning engineer. we are in the process of increasing the machine learning and data science team consists of data scientists and machine learning engineers to apply data science / machine learning / artificial intelligence tools and techniques to develop a highly intelligent chatbots and virtual assistant services to improve the support and delivery of an exceptional customer experience. you will enjoy working with cutting-edge technology, and the ability to see your insights turned into real impact on customers, businesses and society.  
 job highlights
expertise in machine learning.
proficiency in mle, ml ops, and advanced machine learning techniques.
contribute to the development of innovative conversational ai solutions.
 responsibilities:
design, code, train, test, deploy, and iterate on large-scale, distributed machine learning systems.
collaborate with a multi-functional agile team of data science, ux / ui design, product management, and engineering to build new features / products / services that delight our customers.
developer and create end-to-end machine learning feedback loop and integrate it into various customer interaction applications. 
improve existing machine learning models both in terms of model performance and computing performance. 
help drive code review, optimization, testing, and tooling to improve code quality and system reliability.
research and implement best practices to enhance existing machine learning infrastructure and process. 
be part of an active group of data science and machine learning practitioners that shape the direction of machine learning and artificial intelligence of the organization.
 qualifications:
bs or higher in computer science, computer engineering or related technical fields involving machine learning or equivalent technical experience.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills - proven software development skills in multiple programming languages (e.g., python, c, react, angular). 
experience with machine learning software packages (e.g., chatgpt, keras, scikit-learn, xgboost, tensorflow, nltk, caffe, theano). 
knowledge in audio transcriptions, pyannote speaker diarizations and gen ai summarizations.
realtime ai voice bot.
conversational platforms such as rasa and nuance mix. 
familiar with llm model such as chatgpt or gemini.
familiarity with container-based technologies (e.g., docker, kubernetes) and devops practices (e.g., code review, automated testing, ci / cd, logging, performance monitoring). 
front-end technologies such as react and react native (nice to have).
familiar with relational, nosql & vector databases (mysql, mongodb, weaviate, etc).
strong communication skills & collaborative mindset. 
experience with data processing tools (e.g., hadoop, apache spark, apache beam) and cloud platforms (e.g., aws, azure, gcp) considered a plus.

as an intern you will have the day-to-day responsibility of supporting the ai/ml team on data capture, pre-processing and model training.

familiarity with tools and frameworks like python, tensorflow, pytorch, or similar.
knowledge of data preprocessing techniques and annotation tools.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

design the self-running web / mobile applications and software that makes use of that data and automates predictive models.

description:

key responsibilities:
 accurately label and categorize large datasets, including text, audio, images, and video.
review and correct data annotations to ensure quality and consistency.
work closely with the ai and machine learning teams to understand project-specific guidelines.

meet daily/weekly annotation targets while maintaining high-quality standards.

title: ai programmer
description:
about the role

jcl credit leasing sdn bhd is seeking an experienced it ai programmer to join our dynamic team based in kuala lumpur. in this full-time position, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing cutting-edge artificial intelligence (ai) solutions that will drive the company's digital transformation and enhance our service offerings to clients.
what you'll be doing
design, develop, and implement robust ai models and algorithms to solve complex business problems
collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective ai-powered solutions
continuously optimise and refine ai models to improve performance and accuracy
develop and maintain high-quality, efficient, and scalable ai-driven applications and services
conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the reliability and integrity of ai systems
stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in ai and machine learning
mentor and train junior developers to expand the company's ai capabilities
what we're looking for
bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field
solid experience in ai/machine learning programming, preferably in a commercial environment
proficient in programming languages such as python, tensorflow, and pytorch
strong understanding of ai algorithms, neural networks, and data preprocessing techniques
experience in deploying and optimising ai models in production environments
excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen eye for detail
able to join immediately
fresh graduates are encouraged to apply (starting salary: rm3,000)
staff benefits:
1. annual medical checkup (leader and above)
2. annual medical checkup (staff work more than 1 year and aged above 30 years)
3. housing allowance 
4. education benefits 
5. medical life and accident insurance for all staff 
6. position allowance (instructor and leader) 
7. birth allowance
8. loyalty award 
9. cleaning and good attendance award 
10. team entertainment allowance 
11. bereavement allowance 
12. field visit allowance 
13. accommodation allowance (for visit)

title: machine learning engineer (artificial intelligence)
description:
we are seeking a highly motivated individual, the best of the bests talent to join our team as a machine learning engineer (artificial intelligence). we welcome new graduates as well as experienced professionals who have the passion, curiosity, ability, and determination to be the best ml or ai engineer.
  responsibilities:
design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms for complex and unique datasets, using various techniques such as mathematical modeling, scikit-learn, nlp, cnn, rnn, dl, rl, video transformers, gan, llm, rag, prompt engineering, gpt, ai agent, foundation models, gpt, mcp, vlm, and vla
collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract insights, identify business opportunities and provide data-driven recommendations
stay up-to-date with the latest machine learning and ai techniques and tools
communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner
 requirements:
bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, actuarial science, informatics, information science or related fields
strong analytical skills and attention to detail
participation in kaggle, mathematics olympiad or similar competitions is a plus
excellent programming skills in python, r, java, or c++
familiar with ml frameworks such as tensorflow, keras, pytorch, mlflow, automl, tensorrt, cuda, huggingface, langchain, llamaindex
excellent communication and collaboration skills
experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning models
customer centric and committed to deliver the best ai results to customers
 as a machine learning engineer, you will receive guidance from experienced senior ai specialists and have opportunities for professional growth and advancement within the company. we also encourage vibe coding.
 possible future career paths after 2 years include senior machine learning engineer, ai architect, ai team lead, data scientist, data architect, data lead, research engineer, senior research engineer.
 please note that this position is only for the best of the bests, and we expect candidates to have a strong mathematical background and the grit to solve complex problems. if you believe you have what it takes to excel in this challenging position, apply now.
 fresh graduates are also encouraged to apply!

title: junior / intermediate data analyst
location: kuala lumpur city centre, kuala lumpur
description:
job overview:
we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented junior or intermediate data analyst to join our team in kuala lumpur city centre. this role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals who are passionate about using data to drive insights, build models, and support business decisions. the successful candidate will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop predictive models, and translate complex data into actionable strategies.
key responsibilities:
collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources.
perform data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and key insights to support business objectives.
build and evaluate predictive models using machine learning techniques for forecasting and classification tasks.
collaborate with business teams to define analytics needs and deliver data-driven solutions.
performance monitoring and debugging of deployed models.
document analytical processes, model assumptions, and data handling workflows.
contribute to the development of data models to support business strategy.
stay up-to-date with the best practices in analytics, statistical modeling, and data science.
requirements:
bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field.
solid understanding of data analysis, statistics, and predictive modeling techniques.
solid understanding of programming fundamentals, with proficiency in languages such as python or matlab will be a plus.
exposure to machine learning methods such as linear/logistic regression, decision trees, clustering, and time series forecasting.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a creative approach to tackling technical challenges.
proficiency in using data manipulation and plotting libraries (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn).
experience with version control (e.g., git) and basic cloud computing (e.g., aws, google cloud) is a plus.
strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex analyses in a clear and concise manner.
ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
text:
junior / intermediate data analyst developers/programmers (information & communication technology) job overview:
we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented junior or intermediate data analyst to join our team in kuala lumpur city centre. this role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals who are passionate about using data to drive insights, build models, and support business decisions. the successful candidate will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop predictive models, and translate complex data into actionable strategies.
key responsibilities:
collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources.
perform data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and key insights to support business objectives.
build and evaluate predictive models using machine learning techniques for forecasting and classification tasks.
collaborate with business teams to define analytics needs and deliver data-driven solutions.
performance monitoring and debugging of deployed models.
document analytical processes, model assumptions, and data handling workflows.
contribute to the development of data models to support business strategy.
stay up-to-date with the best practices in analytics, statistical modeling, and data science.
requirements:
bachelor’s degree in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a related field.
solid understanding of data analysis, statistics, and predictive modeling techniques.
solid understanding of programming fundamentals, with proficiency in languages such as python or matlab will be a plus.
exposure to machine learning methods such as linear/logistic regression, decision trees, clustering, and time series forecasting.
strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a creative approach to tackling technical challenges.
proficiency in using data manipulation and plotting libraries (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn).
experience with version control (e.g., git) and basic cloud computing (e.g., aws, google cloud) is a plus.
strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex analyses in a clear and concise manner.
ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

title: data scientist
company: western digital tech and regional center (m) sdn bhd
description:
job description
responsibilities
work with data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, process & product engineers, design engineers, etc collaboratively to develop new data science solutions that improve productivity and operations metrics.
researching and developing scalable generative-ai solutions using aws bedrock platform, large language models (llm) and prompt engineering for factory/engineering usage
deploy models and solutions using devops/mlops tools such as docker, kubernetes, mlflow, aws & edge to ensure scalability and reproducibility.
collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate ai/ml algorithms, image analytics and software into the analytics systems (including chatbot/ar/computer vision) as well as develop prototypes.
design, develop, deploy and maintain analytics systems/solutions (data engineering, data science, chatbot, ai, generative-ai, ar, computer vision and visualization/web app) independently and delivered on time.
meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning.
translate user request into analytics solution from a system perspective. prepare and deliver presentations with data visualizations and business conclusions.
constantly learn new front tier technology and creatively apply/deliver solutions to manufacturing operations to meet kpis.
qualification
masters or bachelor degree in computer science, data science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant work experience and education background.
we will also consider applicants with the equivalent combination of education, technical expertise, training, or work experience.
preferably minimum 1-2 years of working experience in related field (generative-ai & chatbot).
skills
required: python, llm, prompt engineering, chatbot, generative -ai, augmented reality, computer vision
added advantage: agentic ai and multi-agent architecture.  
practical experience in application of ml and deep learning algorithms.
sql, relational databases, big data platforms, aws redshift, presto, etl, ssis etc.
some experience with web front end development: .net, vb.net, c#, html/css, javascript, nodejs, jquery & angular
ability to learn quickly and become productive on new technologies, apis, development languages and frameworks.
experience in data mining, data wrangling, and handling json, csv files.
hands on experience with docker, kubernetes, edge computing and aws.. etc
experience with data visualization methods (spotfire, powerbi, grafana)
the ability to problem solves and provide complex solutions with minimal supervision
knowledge of agile development, scrum and application lifecycle management
excellent communications and presentation skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives. a great team player.
self-motivated, strong ownership and ability to work independently with minimal supervision
additional information
western digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. as a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. we believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. we are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
western digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. in your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
notice to candidates: western digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on western digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. please be aware that western digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to western digitals ethics helpline or email compliance@wdc.com
